title: The Desk Name Plate Mix-Up
setting: Carver & Associates Insurance, cubicle floor, Monday 9 AM
premise: Every desk name plate on the third floor has been swapped around over the weekend. Forty employees are sitting at the wrong desks. Someone did this as a prank.

suspects.name: Benny Shaw
suspects.motive: Lost the cubicle lottery and got the worst desk location near the bathroom
suspects.alibi: I was at a wedding out of state all weekend. I drove four hours Friday after work and didn't get back until Sunday night. My car's toll records confirm the trip.

suspects.name: Claudia Voss
suspects.motive: Thought it would be a harmless team-building exercise to start the week
suspects.alibi: I came into the office Saturday around 10 AM to water the office plants — I volunteered for the weekend plant care schedule. I was there about thirty minutes.

suspects.name: Pete Garrison
suspects.motive: Angry about the new seating chart that moved him away from his team
suspects.alibi: I was home all weekend doing yard work. My neighbor borrowed my lawnmower Saturday morning and returned it Sunday afternoon. I never left the neighborhood.

suspects.name: Olivia Chen
suspects.motive: Wanted to prove to management that the open floor plan is confusing and impractical
suspects.alibi: I spent Saturday at my daughter's soccer tournament from 8 AM to 4 PM. Sunday I ran errands and did laundry. I have photos from the tournament on my phone.

clues.title: Weekend Sign-In Sheet
clues.content: The building's weekend sign-in sheet shows only one visitor on Saturday: Claudia Voss at 9:55 AM. No one signed in on Sunday.

clues.title: Time Estimate
clues.content: Facilities estimates swapping forty name plates would take a single person at least forty-five minutes. The name plates are screwed into desk panels and require a Phillips-head screwdriver.

clues.title: Plant Care Duration
clues.content: Claudia says she was there for about thirty minutes to water plants. But the building security exit log shows she didn't leave until 11:42 AM — nearly two hours after signing in at 9:55 AM.

hints.text: Consider how long the prank would have taken and who had enough time in the building to pull it off.
Does the amount of time one suspect claims to have spent in the office match the actual building exit records?
